title: Why did you discontinue Twisted Treeline
body: 3v3 was the prefect time to practise a new champ for a first time without having to play a full game, lets us start with a little more money to practise. Im concerned because this was our basic warm up mode, some champs were not viable but who cares, now we have to play a full game or play as a random champion that i fuckin hate... pardon my language... but sometimes im just in a one trick mode and want to have fun with that champ. so we (mostly I) would really enjoy if you could bring this game mode back. from from the bottom of my heart :(     sad violin melody

replies.body:
It didnt have players, because Riot didnt encourage it in the first place (By not changing stuff, and so on), and not the other round.
( I mean its not that Riot didnt change it because no players ---> No players, because no changes).

Its very sad, because its EXACTLY what Riot wanted.
I mean Riot talks about "Fast paced games", and TT is/was EXACTLY that... -___-
I agree i love the fast paced games, i love the objectives in it, the game just seems so fun i dont understand what other people dont understand
I played this game mode when it had a dragon, red and blue buff, it used to be so cool but they made it weaker and weaker every patch
Small indie company, they just don't have the money to keep it up, if you want various game modes look towards Smite, only they with their billions of dollars cna keep up several game modes at once!

Modes that consistently bring in a large majority of players instead of a small minor fractions of the community. The alternate modes in Smite are there because they're used by enough users, not just because "we can have them up lol".
